pulltitle: Pin to a version of oauth2 that does not generate an error when trying to connect
pullsbody:
The library is not pinned to a version of oauth2, and the latest release has broken our tests [1]. You can see an example of the failures in our Jenkins [2].

This pull request pins to a version of oauth2 that does not cause this error.

@diox  If possible, please review, and if acceptable please merge and release a new package to PyPI.

[1] https://github.com/mozilla/marketplace-tests
[2] https://webqa-ci.mozilla.com/view/Buildmaster/job/marketplace.stage.developer_hub.saucelabs/423/HTML_Report/
pull_commit_message: Pin to a version of oauth2 that does not generate an error when trying to connect

pullsbody:
Another experimental restructuring of the client. This is not merge ready. This is only for review and for getting more ideas.

Previously, I submitted a PR which also had changes to restructure this project - #28.

This looks more solid to me and therefore I went ahead and did more work in this direction. So, ideas please? :)

directory layout changed

 * lib renamed to marketplace
 * tests moved inside marketplace

classes modified

setup tools added to setup.py to provide requirements
no apps package anymore
raise notimplemented added

removed consumer dependency injection
some simple pylint fixes
docstrings and stuff

three_legged removed from __init__
urls as a static
not used mimetype keyword removed
fixed fetch for screenshot methods
pylint fixes
info about additional packages needed for testing purposes

pulltitle: moved the stuff a little so it was possible to create something in form ...
pullsbody:
...of an

application

This is a beginning of an idea.
It allows to actually put the stuff on the marketplace.
`nosetests` is still testing the lib

```
CONSUMER_KEY=somekey CONSUMER_SECRET=somesecret python main.py is_manifest_valid somemanifestid
```

is checking if manifest is valid

pull_commit_message:
A little bit of a refactoring

* DEF WEBAPP URL removed
* Commands are run in a bit more DRY way
* some ordering in imports
Adding BSD License

using the right response and request methods
add ability to use environment variables (comment out the mock if real
connection needed):

    CONSUMER_KEY=someckey CONSUMER_SECRET=somesecret nosetests

importing just the environ function from the os
moved test out of tests dir (there is only one file)

refactored
* unused functions removed
* debug removed
* some comments fixed

requirements added

* update added to tests
* status and delete added to lib and tests
* docs refactored
